review_text: Service was phenomenal.  We had Brittany as our server on Friday night.  The place was packed, so much there was only 1 menu left when we arrived for our reservation.  We had another engagement that evening and Brittany was able to get us in and out with salads, main course, wine, and bread in 50 minutes.  This allowed us to be on time for our second event of the evening.Food was great and the ambiance is little Italy in Cleveland so it's hard to say anything negative!
about_business: Italian, mediterranean, gluten-free options, vegetarian and vegan options.…
vibes: Choose a star rating on a scale of 1 to 5

review_text: My family and I were visiting Cleveland from NYC and stumbled upon Mia Bella on a walk through Little Italy. It was so good that we came back again the next night! The food is incredible and the service was amazing. Our waitress, Jen, was so kind and warm and Lorna was the sweetest. If you have yet to try this place, please do...you won't be disappointed.
about_business: Italian, mediterranean, gluten-free options, vegetarian and vegan options.…
vibes: Choose a star rating on a scale of 1 to 5

review_text: The BEST meal I've had in Cleveland!Moved here a couple of months ago and am still new to the food scene. Heard about this place through a coworker (who said it was the best spot in Little Italy).We ordered the honey and ricotta bread course...still thinking about that dish...the bread was buttery, garlicky, SOFT yet crispy. The whipped ricotta was insanely delicious. We split the ragu, frutti di mare, and scallops. The scallops were 10/10 best bite of the night. Ragu was fantastic. That sauce tasted like it had been simmering for hours. The frutti di mare was OK (not sure if squid ink pasta is my thing yet), but the sauce had a nice spice and a bold, seafood-forward flavor.Portions were so generous and pricing was honestly fair for this 2025 economy. The ambience was classic, no-fuss Italian fare: white tablecloths, Frank Sinatra , humble staff. And best part is it felt fancy and yet no one would judge you for wearing whatever you wanted.Mia Bella is no-frills, fantastic Italian cooking. We will be back...and back...many times.
about_business: Italian, mediterranean, gluten-free options, vegetarian and vegan options.…
vibes: Choose a star rating on a scale of 1 to 5

review_text: The service was extremely poor - our server clearly didn't know the menu, couldn't answer basic questions, and only asked if we wanted cheese on our pasta after we were basically finished eating. On top of that, our food arrived cold, which made the meal even more underwhelming.I had high hopes for this restaurant, but between the lack of attentiveness and poor execution, it felt like we weren't valued as guests. Definitely not worth the price or the hype.

review_text: Went to dinner with friends Saturday 6/21. Had reservations but we arrived early. Checked with hostess and she said she would see if she could get us in early,  which we appreciated. Left phone number and walked the area. 15 mins git a call and we got seated 45 mins ahead of reservation!  Thank you very much.Now the VERY disappoiting part of the evening. When the server, Gizem came to our table, W3, she first asked if we wanted water or sparkling water. We elected sparkling water. Took the appetizer and drink order and left. Came back with two bottles of sparkling water and then took the dinner orders. I chose the Cheese Tortellini and my wife asked about the Short Rib Bolognese. Server asked my wife if she wanted the Ragu, which was much better. My wife said yes, not knowing it was a completely different dish, which the server never explained. Not only that, the server did not state the specials nor their respective costs.  Also our dinner partners also had the same selections on sparkling water and the Short Rib Bolognese, then Ragu changes.The dishes were excellent, served hot and quickly after placing orders.Finished and received our bills! With the server NOT TELLING each of us the additional costs for sparkling waters and two RAGU dishes instead of the original plates of Short Rib Bolognese, this server inflated each bill by $30!!! No $30 will not break me, but the way the padding of the dishes, is and was, highly deceptive. This does not present Mia Bella in a good light for future visits or recommendations.AND I'm not even going in on charging me a processing fee for using my credit card!!
about_business: Italian, mediterranean, gluten-free options, vegetarian and vegan options.…
vibes: Choose a star rating on a scale of 1 to 5

review_text: I got the cheese tortellini because it was highly recommended on yelp and beli. I went on a Tuesday evening and there were still a good amount of customers, so l can see why a reservation may be needed for a Friday or weekend. The spicy sauce was just the right about of spice, and the pasta was cooked to perfection. The only critique I have is that some of the peas that were served with the dish was quite undercooked and starchy/hard so it slightly ruined the texture of the dish for me which is why I had to knock it down 1 star:/ my server was very nice and my food came out quickly.

review_text: Probably the best Italian restaurant in the area We went on a weekday and it was packed, but luckily got a table outside, which I really enjoyed. We ordered oysters, sautéed calamari, spaghetti bolognese, and steak all so delicious we cleared our plates.

review_text: Candace was our excellent server and she couldn't have been more helpful. She knew the menu and asked the right questions to hone in on what she thought we would like. Five stars!We started with the burratta salad which was so yummy. Then we shared the  Chef's Favorite pizza which was cooked perfectly and had a subtle little kick to it. Next we shared a fantastic chicken piccata which Candace had the chef make with boneless chicken breast. We topped all that off with a creme brûlée that was the best we've ever had. The only thing I would change is the location of the table which was in a very high traffic spot next to the bar. Otherwise 5 stars!

review_text: Excellent food yet again this evening. The crispy Brussels sprouts weren't crispy but they were still unbelievably great! Super duper flavorful- grilled flavor, salt, some balsamic and sun dried tomatoes. Just great. The shrimp saganaki was beautiful and flavorful. Super rich tomato cream sauce drowning large shrimp over several slices of robust halloumi cheese. The chef's favorite pizza was unremarkable. It had a rather dry overly chewy crust and was lacking in cheese but did have enough spicy sausage and onion topping.

review_text: Wowowow! Was blown away by Mia Bella and the service was the icing on the cake! We did not have a reservation; although they were fully reserved for the evening we were able to be immediately sat at the bar near the kitchen. It was so fun watching the chefs prepare the meals while we wait for delicious food. Gino was an amazing server who treated us well and knew exactly what we needed even before we asked. Everyone was very friendly, service could not have been better. The only negative thing I would say is that the tables are a little close together. My cheese tortellini was delicious and I'm excited for my leftovers!

review_text: The food was good, and the service was good, but the prices just don't make sense anymore from when I visited just a year ago. Compared to other restaurants on the block like Mama Santes and Trattoria, which offer similar food at much more reasonable prices, this place feels overpriced for what you get.They don't even provide their bread and dipping oil anymore unless you pay extra, which just adds to the feeling that they've cut back on service while raising prices. The quality has stayed the same--if not declined from when I had visited a year ago--but the cost keeps going up.There are better options nearby for the same experience at a better price.

review_text: We had an extra day in Cleveland and at the recommendation of a friend's brother, popped into Mia Bella for dinner. But before that, let's talk parking. On that strip, it's pretty much valet parking only. My recommendation, if you go out ~0.3 miles of the strip, there are plenty of street parking in front of the residences that you can use. Just park there and it's a straight shot walk down the sidewalk to the strip.We get there, no reservation, and they seat us immediately. Our waitress is amazing! Tells us about specials, quick to serve, great service all around. I got a glass of red, some oysters, the filet, and bread to start. Everything was tasty. Th is place is great and if you're in the area and want to get some nice dining, for Cleveland, check it out.

review_text: Food was delicious and the ambience is nice. I had the chicken risotto and a friend had gluten free fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. Only caveat is when it's full it gets extremely loud and hard to hear yourself talk. It also gets a little cramped so wouldn't recommend for larger parties. There also is a 3% added fee for credit cards so just be aware of that.

review_text: First time visiting Little Italy and I am so glad that we chose to dine at this restaurant!The dirty martini was so delicious and perfect! The lobster ravioli was so flavorful and fresh and my husband's shrimp scampi pizza was amazing as well.  Also the side salad had fresh mozzarella and so good!  Also our server was very polite and knowledgeable.This place did not disappoint and needless to say we will definitely return hopefully soon!! I would give it 10 stars if I could!!

review_text: We enjoyed a great dinner at Mia Bella, 8/13/2025.  Our server Jordan was a joy and very attentive. We started with the Shrimp Saganaki. (Be sure to save some bread to really enjoy the sauce).  As an entrée I had the veal Braciole and my Husband ordered the Scampi Pappardelle. Both were delicious and very well presented. The dining room is comfortable and we had a table by the windows. For a light desert we shared an Affogato.  In our opinion Mia Bella is a treasure in Cleveland's Little Italy.

review_text: Starting off, service was above and beyond, very helpful and we were never really left wanting anything if a little quick and assuming on more wine hahaFood was good, appetizers really the stars for the most part. Meatballs a little tougher than I usually prefer, but the shrimp saganaki was fabulous, could drink that sauce, and the eggplant was also very good. The marinara was very fresh. Bread was to die for as well, great texture!Entrees at the table included risotto, pesto bucatini, Caesar salad, pepperoni pizza and I had the cheese tortellini with shrimp. It was very good, I do feel I've had better versions of this at other places but I enjoyed and took home leftovers. Pesto bucatini and the pizza were also highlights on the table.It was a bit loud in there but it was a cool vibe! They brought out cassata cake to end the meal which was solid, could've used a little more custard but very good.

review_text: Fantastic food, drink, and ambiance in little Italy. Best to sit outside if the weather is good to catch the liveliness of this block. Excellent and attentive service by Gino who highly recommended the Gnocchi. But we opted for the pesto verde and lobster ravioli. Arugula salad provided some greenery.Parking is tough in this area, recommend going to the parking lot next to the transit overpass.

review_text: Perfect restaurant for a birthday dinner with family. We made the reservation, a must on Friday night,  and were seated right in cue. Mia Bella was crowded but the service never slacked. After reading off the specials and ordering a few bottles of wine we got started with bread, soups, mussels and fresh octopus salad. At this point in the evening one could be full, but not at Mia Bella, you must eat!The rigatoni with meat sauce was full of flavor, especially with the addition of meatballs on the side. The clam linguine was fresh, light and delicious. Now to the branzino, cooked perfectly, where the fish comes clean from the filet. Dessert and coffee were fantastic, cheesecake and crème brûlée are a no brainer, you are in Little Italy, dessert is necessary.Great atmosphere, friendly and professional service, and amazing food, so make that reservation.
about_business: Italian, mediterranean, gluten-free options, vegetarian and vegan options.…
